text: Charles Frederick Calladine (24 January 1911 – 29 October 1983) was an English professional footballer who played as a wing half. Born in Wessington, Derbyshire, Calladine started his football career with Scunthorpe & Lindsey United before moving to Birmingham in 1930, for whom he played more than 100 games in the Football League First Division. He was a physically strong player with pace and a powerful shot. After leaving Birmingham he played for Blackburn Rovers and Guildford City, whom he helped finish as runners-up in the 1938–39 Southern League. He died in Matlock, Derbyshire, in 1983 at the age of 72. ==References== Category:1911 births Category:People from North East Derbyshire District Category:1983 deaths Category:English footballers Category:Association football wing halves Category:Scunthorpe United F.C. players Category:Birmingham City F.C. players Category:Blackburn Rovers F.C. players Category:Guildford City F.C. players Category:English Football League players Category:Southern Football League players
title: Charlie Calladine
